sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $9.00. Despite missing quarterly EPS estimates, the company exceeded revenue forecasts and maintains a market capitalization of $2.02 billion. Institutional investors hold a significant portion of the stock.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) has received a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from nine brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $9.00. The company reported Q3 EPS of $0.04, missing estimates, but revenue of $270.85 million surpassed expectations and grew 9.1% year-over-year. Institutional ownership is high at 82%, with significant investments from Invesco and Azora Capital.

feed.title: Why Payoneer Global Stock Plunged by Almost 4% Today
feed.summary: Payoneer Global (NASDAQ: PAYO) shares dropped by almost 4% today after Benchmark analyst Mark Palmer cut his price target for the fintech company from $12 to $10. Despite the reduction, Palmer maintained his "buy" recommendation, indicating continued bullish sentiment on Payoneer's prospects. The stock's performance reflects the immediate impact of analyst revisions on market valuation.

feed.title: Why Payoneer Global Stock Plunged by Almost 4% Today
feed.summary: Payoneer Global (NASDAQ: PAYO) shares dropped nearly 4% after a Benchmark analyst, Mark Palmer, reduced his price target for the fintech company from $12 to $10 per share. This adjustment was attributed to expectations of continued macroeconomic uncertainty impacting the company's fundamentals. Despite the revised price target, Palmer maintained a "buy" recommendation, citing Payoneer's long-term growth potential in providing services to small and mid-sized businesses.

feed.title: Payoneer Global (NASDAQ:PAYO) Shares Down 4.9% on Analyst Downgrade
feed.summary: Payoneer Global (NASDAQ:PAYO) shares fell 4.9% after Benchmark lowered its price target from $12 to $10, though keeping a "buy" rating. The company's stock experienced light trading volume and closed at $5.78, reaching a low of $5.49. Despite an EPS miss in its latest quarterly earnings, Payoneer Global's revenue exceeded expectations, and the stock maintains an average analyst rating of "Moderate Buy."

feed.title: Payoneer Global price target lowered to $10 from $12 at Benchmark
feed.summary: Benchmark has lowered its price target for Payoneer Global (PAYO) from $12 to $10, while maintaining a Buy rating on the shares. This adjustment follows a meeting with Payoneer's VP of Investor Relations where discussions included SMB adaptation to U.S. tariff policy, growth in B2B payments, and stablecoin initiatives. The information was initially reported by TheFly.

feed.title: Why Payoneer (PAYO) Shares Are Falling Today
feed.summary: Shares of cross-border payment platform Payoneer (NASDAQ:PAYO) fell 4.3% in the afternoon session after Benchmark lowered its price target on the stock to $10 from $12, citing macroeconomic uncertainty and challenges faced by the company's small and medium-sized business customers. Despite the reduced price target, Benchmark maintained a "Buy" rating on Payoneer shares. The company's stock has been volatile, with a significant drop earlier this year due to decreased profitability despite revenue growth.

feed.title: Payoneer Global (NASDAQ:PAYO) Price Target Cut to $10.00 by Analysts at Benchmark
feed.summary: Benchmark has reduced its price target for Payoneer Global (NASDAQ:PAYO) from $12.00 to $10.00, while maintaining a "buy" rating. This new price target suggests a potential upside of approximately 73% from its current price of $5.78. Despite mixed quarterly results where EPS missed estimates, revenue exceeded expectations, showing 9.1% year-over-year growth.

feed.title: Payoneer: Improving Fundamentals Are Yet To Reflect On The Quant Metrics
feed.summary: Payoneer underperformed in 2025 with a 42% YTD loss, influenced by tariff concerns and interest rate risks, warranting a neutral investment stance. Although its top-line growth is moderating, with revenue up 10.58% YoY and significant expansion in China and emerging markets, profitability metrics are mixed. While gross margin is robust at 84%, the EBIT margin trails peers and the sector median.

feed.title: First Week of August 2026 Options Trading For Payoneer Global (PAYO)
feed.summary: New options contracts for Payoneer Global (PAYO) with an August 2026 expiration have started trading, offering potential opportunities for options sellers due to the longer time to expiration. A detailed analysis of a $6.00 strike price call option suggests a potential 11.88% return for a covered call strategy, with an estimated 34% chance of the contract expiring worthless, boosting returns. The article provides insights into volatility and the potential benefits of this trading strategy for PAYO investors.

feed.title: Should Payoneer’s AI Fraud Upgrade With Oscilar Require Action From Payoneer Global (PAYO) Investors?
feed.summary: Payoneer recently partnered with Oscilar to integrate AI- and machine-learning-based fraud and risk intelligence into its global payment systems, aiming to enhance fraud prevention and customer experience. This move, alongside an expanded share buyback plan, could strengthen Payoneer's competitive position and amplify future earnings recovery, though investors should still consider broader risks like competition and emerging payment technologies. The article suggests this upgrade is incrementally helpful but doesn't radically alter the near-term focus on stabilizing margins or the long-term threat from blockchain payments.

feed.title: Payoneer (PAYO) valuation check as it adopts Oscilar’s AI platform to modernize fraud and risk intelligence
feed.summary: Payoneer (PAYO) has partnered with Oscilar to enhance its fraud and risk intelligence using AI, as its stock displays mixed performance with a recent gain but a significant year-to-date loss. Analysts view Payoneer as undervalued with a fair value of $8.50 due to its focus on higher-margin B2B payments and value-added services, despite its current P/E ratio being higher than industry averages. The successful implementation of this AI-driven fraud prevention system could support its path to increased profitability and market expansion.

feed.title: Responsive Playbooks and the PAYO Inflection
feed.summary: This article discusses an inflection point for Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ: PAYO), highlighting strong near and mid-term sentiment but a weak long-term outlook. It details various institutional trading strategies, including position, momentum breakout, and risk hedging, along with multi-timeframe signal analysis and support/resistance levels.

feed.title: Payoneer Global partners with Oscilar for real-time fraud intelligence
feed.summary: Payoneer Global has selected Oscilar to enhance its fraud and risk intelligence across its core payment systems. By integrating Oscilar’s AI and machine-learning infrastructure, Payoneer aims to bolster its fraud prevention capabilities through predictive analytics and intelligent automation. Oscilar’s AI Risk Decisioning platform is designed to improve threat detection and adapt in real time to emerging fraud patterns across Payoneer’s global digital payments network.

feed.title: Market Participants Recognise Payoneer Global Inc.'s (NASDAQ:PAYO) Earnings
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) currently has a high price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio of 29x, significantly above the U.S. market average. This elevated P/E is attributed to expectations of strong future earnings growth, with analysts forecasting a 35% EPS increase for the coming year, materially higher than the broader market's 16% growth forecast. Despite a 46% decrease in earnings over the last year, investors appear to be factoring in a substantial recovery and prosperous future for the company.

feed.title: Payoneer (NASDAQ: PAYO) adopts Oscilar AI to upgrade global enterprise risk systems
feed.summary: Payoneer has partnered with Oscilar to integrate its AI Risk Decisioning platform, aiming to modernize fraud prevention across its global payments network. This collaboration will enhance predictive analytics, accelerate model iteration, and enable real-time adaptation to emerging fraud patterns. The goal is to deliver autonomous and scalable controls while maintaining a seamless customer experience for Payoneer's millions of SMBs, marketplaces, and freelancers operating across 7,000 trade corridors.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. $PAYO Shares Sold by Arrowstreet Capital Limited Partnership
feed.summary: Arrowstreet Capital Limited Partnership significantly reduced its stake in Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) by 42.1% during the second quarter, selling 794,029 shares. Despite this, other institutional investors like Vanguard Group Inc. and Invesco Ltd. increased their holdings in Payoneer Global. The company recently reported Q3 earnings of $0.04 per share, missing consensus estimates, and analysts currently maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for PAYO with an average target price of $8.83.

feed.title: Greenvale Capital LLP Purchases Shares of 2,112,765 Payoneer Global Inc. $PAYO
feed.summary: Greenvale Capital LLP has acquired 2,112,765 shares of Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) in Q2, valued at approximately $14.47 million, making it their 14th largest holding. Institutional investors collectively own 82.22% of Payoneer, which currently trades near $5.75 with analysts giving it a "Moderate Buy" rating and an average target price of $8.83. Although Payoneer recently missed EPS expectations, its revenue beat estimates, increasing 9.1% year-over-year.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO): A Bull Case Theory
feed.summary: This article presents a bull thesis on Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO), highlighting its position as a leading cross-border payments platform for SMBs with strong fundamentals, high margins, and sustained revenue growth despite trading at a discount. Key catalysts for future growth include volume and take-rate growth in emerging markets, rising interest income, and expansion of its Checkout product, with a target price of $10 per share. The company is actively acquiring fast-growing customers from emerging markets and expanding its service offerings.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO): A Bull Case Theory
feed.summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO), highlighting it as a leading cross-border payments platform for SMBs. The thesis argues that PAYO is undervalued despite strong fundamentals, superior margins, and significant upside potential, with a target price of $10 per share. Key catalysts include continued volume and take-rate growth in emerging markets, rising interest income, and expansion of its Checkout product.

feed.title: Payoneer Adopts New Executive Severance Plan
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc.'s Compensation Committee adopted a new Change in Control Severance Plan for its executives on November 28, 2025. This plan provides lump sum payments, medical benefit continuation, and immediate equity award vesting upon specific termination events. The CEO and CFO are not currently included but can opt into the new plan.

feed.title: Payoneer Global adopts change in control severance plan for executives
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) announced that its Compensation Committee adopted a Change in Control Severance Plan for executives, including named executive officers. The plan provides severance benefits for executives terminated without cause or who resign for good reason in connection with a change in control. Separately, Payoneer Global reported Q3 2025 earnings that missed analyst expectations, with an EPS of $0.04 against a projected $0.06 and revenue of $248.3 million against an anticipated $263.37 million.

feed.title: How Investors Are Reacting To Payoneer (PAYO) Q3 Results and Bridgewater’s Major Share Accumulation
feed.summary: Payoneer Global recently reported strong Q3 2025 results with a 9% year-over-year revenue increase, alongside a significant share accumulation by Bridgewater Associates, which added nearly 1 million shares. This institutional interest highlights growing confidence in Payoneer's international digital payments growth and its focus on B2B adoption and value-added services. Despite competitive risks and evolving payment technologies, Payoneer's future projections include $1.3 billion in revenue by 2028 and a projected fair value of $8.71, suggesting a 51% upside.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Brokerages
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus recommendation from nine brokerages, with an average one-year price target of $9.57. Despite missing EPS estimates in its recent quarter, the company's revenue beat expectations, rising 9.1% year-over-year. Institutional ownership in Payoneer is high at 82.22%, with major funds increasing their stakes.

feed.title: Payoneer to Participate in the UBS Global Technology and AI Conference
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ: PAYO) announced that its Chief Financial Officer, Bea Ordonez, will participate in a fireside chat at the UBS Global Technology and AI Conference on December 3, 2025. Investors can access the live webcast and replay of the presentation on the company's investor relations website. Payoneer is a global financial technology company empowering cross-border business growth and payments.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO) Matches Q3 Earnings Estimates
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO) reported Q3 earnings of $0.06 per share, matching the Zacks Consensus Estimate but down from $0.11 a year ago. The company's revenues for the quarter were $270.85 million, exceeding estimates by 2.80%. Despite underperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, Payoneer Global currently holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), indicating an expectation to perform in line with the market.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Enters Oversold Territory (PAYO)
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO) shares have entered oversold territory according to the Relative Strength Index (RSI), with a reading of 29.6. This technical indicator suggests that recent heavy selling may be exhausting, potentially signaling an entry point for bullish investors. The stock's current price of $5.79 is near its 52-week low of $5.69, compared to a high of $11.29.

feed.title: 1 Oversold Stock Set for a Comeback and 2 We Ignore - TradingView
feed.summary: This article analyzes three stocks that have recently experienced significant price drops. It recommends buying Payoneer (PAYO) due to its strong revenue growth and share buybacks, while advising against Tenable (TENB) and Leslie's (LESL) due to weak billing growth, slowing demand, and financial risks, respectively. The piece emphasizes fundamental analysis to distinguish between temporary setbacks and structural declines in company performance.

feed.title: A Look Back at Diversified Financial Services Stocks’ Q2 Earnings: Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) Vs The Rest Of The Pack
feed.summary: This article reviews the Q2 earnings performance of diversified financial services stocks, focusing on Berkshire Hathaway and comparing it to peers like Paymentus, NerdWallet, NCR Atleos, and Payoneer. It highlights individual company revenue performance, analyst expectations, and stock movements post-earnings, noting a mixed quarter for the sector overall despite some strong individual performances. The article concludes with a brief market update discussing economic factors influencing stock performance in 2024.

feed.summary: This article reports that Payoneer Global Inc's stock has hit a 52-week low, trading at 5.71 USD. However, due to a client-side exception, the full details of the article are not available.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) Given Average Recommendation of “Moderate Buy” by Analysts - Defense World
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (NASDAQ:PAYO) has received an average recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from analysts. Several institutional investors and hedge funds have recently increased their stakes in Payoneer Global, highlighting growing investor interest. The company operates as a financial technology firm providing a global multi-currency payment infrastructure.

feed.title: 3 Top Stocks Crushing Q3 Earnings With Strong 2024 Guidance
feed.summary: The article highlights three companies, Hims & Hers, Payoneer, and Astera Labs, that significantly outperformed Q3 earnings expectations and provided strong 2024 guidance. Hims & Hers benefited from its compounded GLP-1 treatments, Payoneer experienced growth in cross-border business payments, and Astera Labs is capitalizing on the demand for faster connectivity in AI data centers. These companies are presented as top stocks to watch after their strong performance.

feed.title: Payoneer’s emerging markets strategy: John Caplan on Q2 24
feed.summary: Payoneer reported strong Q2 2024 results, with a 16% YoY increase in revenue to $239.5m and a 30% increase in adjusted EBITDA to $72.8m, driven by its focus on emerging markets. The company's strategy includes building a complete financial stack for cross-border SMBs in these markets and has led to a 27% increase in average revenue per user. Payoneer has also raised its FY 2024 projections for the second time, further bolstering its emerging markets strategy.

feed.title: Payoneer targets growth with more acquisitions
feed.summary: Payoneer, under CEO John Caplan, is aggressively pursuing acquisitions to expand its business-to-business (B2B) cross-border payments services and enter the accounts payable (AP) arena. The company recently acquired Singapore-based Skuad for $61 million, adding payroll and workforce management capabilities. This strategic shift aims to capitalize on the larger $6 trillion B2B payments market, moving beyond its traditional marketplace niche and focusing on larger clients.

feed.title: Payoneer buys HR and payroll startup Skuad
feed.summary: Payoneer (Nasdaq: PAYO) has acquired Skuad, a Singapore-based global workforce and payroll management startup, for $61 million in cash. This acquisition is significant because it expands Payoneer's product offerings for small and medium-sized businesses operating internationally.

feed.title: Payoneer Global Inc (PAYO) Reports Robust Revenue Growth and Profitability Expansion for FY 2023
feed.summary: Payoneer Global Inc. (PAYO) announced significant financial achievements for fiscal year 2023, including a 32% increase in revenue to $831.1 million and a turnaround to over $90 million in net income. The company also saw a remarkable 323% growth in adjusted EBITDA, reaching $205.1 million, and provided strong guidance for 2024, projecting further revenue growth and profitability. This performance highlights Payoneer's effective strategy in the digital global economy and its focus on growing its Ideal Customer Profiles (ICPs) and Average Revenue Per User (ARPU).

feed.title: Palestine/Israel: Criticism against Wise and Payoneer for freezing the accounts of Palestinians in Gaza in disproportionate adherence to regulations; Incl. Co. comment
feed.summary: Wise and Payoneer are facing criticism for freezing the accounts of Palestinians in Gaza, the West Bank, and Israel, as well as those living abroad, often without clear explanations. While the companies deny discrimination, they cite adherence to financial regulations and anti-terror financing laws as reasons. This situation highlights a broader issue of financial exclusion and disproportionate punishment faced by Palestinians due to strict financial regulations, especially in conflict zones.

feed.title: Notable Two Hundred Day Moving Average Cross - PAYO
feed.summary: Shares of Payoneer Global Inc (PAYO) crossed below their 200-day moving average of $5.37 on Monday, trading as low as $5.34 per share. The stock was down approximately 2.7% on the day, with its 52-week trading range spanning from $3.325 to $8.04. This event signals a notable technical shift for investors to consider.

feed.title: How to Receive Payments Through Payoneer
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to receive payments using Payoneer, an international money transfer platform. It details what Payoneer is, how to create and verify an account, and the process of receiving payments. The article also covers Payoneer's security measures, fees, pros and cons, and whether it's a worthwhile service for freelancers and businesses needing cross-border payment solutions.

feed.title: Testlio: The Most User-Friendly Testing Site (Global + Payment Proof)
feed.summary: This article reviews Testlio, a functional testing website, highlighting its user-friendly interface and payment structure. It explains the signup process, assessment requirements, and potential earnings of $10-$20 per hour, offering payment proof and comparing it to competitor uTest. The author details why Testlio is a suitable platform for crowdtesting.

feed.title: Walmart expanding its India sourcing to $10 billion by 2027
feed.summary: Walmart plans to expand its sourcing from India to $10 billion annually by 2027. The company is encouraging Indian manufacturers and trading companies to become cross-border sellers on Walmart Marketplace to reach over 120 million US consumers. Walmart is also providing support and resources to Indian sellers, including dedicated account managers, Walmart Fulfillment Services, and advertising opportunities.

feed.title: Payoneer: The world’s go-to partner for digital commerce everywhere
feed.summary: This article highlights Payoneer's role in empowering freelancers and entrepreneurs in the Philippines' growing gig economy. Miguel Warren, Payoneer's VP & SEA regional head, discusses the company's significant growth in the country since 2009 and its services that enable global payments and financial flexibility for its users. Payoneer aims to further support its customers through strategic partnerships and by adapting to the global digitalization shift.

feed.title: Payoneer and FTAC Olympus Acquisition Corp. Complete Business Combination
feed.summary: Payoneer Inc. and FTAC Olympus Acquisition Corp. have completed their business combination, with Payoneer beginning to trade under the ticker symbol PAYO. The transaction, approved by FTOC shareholders and including a $300 million PIPE investment, positions Payoneer to further capitalize on global commerce expansion. The company's global management team will continue to lead, aiming to grow its platform for businesses worldwide.

feed.title: Online payment company Payoneer goes public after SPAC merger
feed.summary: Payments provider Payoneer went public on the Nasdaq stock exchange after closing a merger with a special-purpose acquisition company (SPAC) backed by fintech entrepreneur Betsy Cohen. The deal valued the company at about $3.3 billion, and Payoneer expects significant revenue growth in 2021 due to accelerated digital commerce. The company plans to use its new public currency for bolder investments and acquisitions to expand its services.
